biography.bio: Gianni Rodari was born on October 23, 1920 in Omegna, Piedmont, Italy. He was a writer and actor, known for Chipollino (1972), How the Toys Saved Christmas (1996) and Cipollino, the Onion Boy (1961). He was married to Maria Teresa Ferretti. He died on April 14, 1980 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Gianni Rodari

biography.bio: Aleksandr Elistratov is an actor, known for Chipollino (1972), Dorogoy malchik (1974) and Vsmotrites' v eto litso (1972).
biography.name: Aleksandr Elistratov

biography.placeOfBirth: Urazovo, Kursk Governorate, Russian SFSR, USSR [now Kursk Oblast, Russia]
biography.bio: Vladimir Basov was a notable Soviet actor and director best known for the leading role as Bruno in Shchit i mech (1968), which he also directed, and his numerous supporting roles, such as Floor Polisher in Romance à Moscou (1964) (aka.. Walking the Streets of Moscow (1963), among other works. He was born Vladimir Pavlovich Basov on September 17, 1923, in a small town of Urazov, Kursk province, central Russia. His father died in a tragic accident, and young Basov was raised by a single mother. During the Second World War he was wounded in the battlefield fighting the Nazis, and was decorated for his courage. From 1947 - 1951 he studied acting and directing under Mikhail Romm and Sergei Yutkevich at Soviet State Insitute of Cinema (VGIK), graduating in 1952 as film director. From 1952 to 1987 he was a film director at Mosfilm Studios in Moscow. Basov shot to fame with the leading role as Bruno in popular Soviet war drama Shchit i mech (1968) which he also directed. At that time Basov was among the most popular Soviet filmmakers. He directed such TV movies as Opasnyy povorot (1972), and the popular series Dni Turbinykh (1976) adapted after the eponymous book by Mikhail A. Bulgakov. However, with his success came the attendant pressures, and he suffered from chronic alcoholism, depression, and had several strokes and heart attacks. Vladimir Basov was designated People's Actor of USSR (1983), and was awarded the State Prize of Russia (1982). He died of a second heart attack on September 17, 1987, in his Moscow home, and was laid to rest in Moscow, Russia.
biography.name: Vladimir Basov

biography.bio: Rina Zelyonaya was born on November 7, 1901 in Tashkent, Russian Empire as Yekaterina Vasilyevna Zelyonaya. She was an actress and writer, known for Operation 'Y' & Other Shurik's Adventures (1965), The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson: The Hound of the Baskervilles (1981) and Vovka v Tridevyatom tsarstve (1965). She died on April 1, 1991 in Moscow, RSFSR, USSR.
biography.name: Rina Zelyonaya

biography.bio: Aleksandra Panova was born on May 26, 1899 in Moscow, Russian Empire as Aleksandra Petrovna Panova. She was an actress, known for Seryozha (1960), Chipollino (1972) and Greshnitsa (1962). She died on October 8, 1981.
biography.name: Aleksandra Panova

biography.bio: Vitalik Kerdimun is an actor, known for Solaris (1972) and Chipollino (1972).
biography.name: Vitalik Kerdimun

biography.bio: Nadir Malishevsky was born on May 23, 1918 as Nadir Mikhaylovich Malishevskiy. He was an actor, known for Le tour du monde de Sadko (1953), We'll Live Till Monday (1968) and Le croiseur Variague (1947). He died on December 6, 1977 in Moscow, RSFSR, USSR.
biography.name: Nadir Malishevsky

biography.placeOfBirth: village Nizhniy Uslon, Sviyazhsk uyezd, Kazan Governorate, Russian Empire [now Verkhneuslonsky District, Republic of Tatarstan, Russia]
biography.bio: Vladimir Belokurov was born on July 8, 1904 in village Nizhniy Uslon, Sviyazhsk uyezd, Kazan Governorate, Russian Empire as Vladimir Vyacheslavovich Belokurov. He was an actor, known for Wings of Victory (1941), Striped Trip (1961) and Zhukovsky (1950). He died on January 28, 1973 in Moscow, RSFSR, USSR.
biography.name: Vladimir Belokurov

biography.placeOfBirth: Terijoki, Vyborg, Finland [now Zelenogorsk, Kurortny District, St. Petersburg, Russia]
biography.bio: Georgiy Vitsin was born on April 23, 1918 in Terijoki, Vyborg, Finland as Georgi Mikhailovich Vitsin. He was an actor, known for Gentlemen of Fortune (1971), Pyos Barbos i neobychnyj kross (1961) and Kidnapping, Caucasian Style (1967). He died on October 20, 2001 in Moscow, Russia.
biography.name: Georgiy Vitsin

biography.placeOfBirth: Sverdlovsk, Uralskaya oblast, RSFSR, USSR [now Ekaterinburg, Sverdlovskaya oblast, Russia]
biography.bio: Roman Tkachuk was born on August 31, 1932 in Sverdlovsk, Uralskaya oblast, RSFSR, USSR as Roman Denisovich Tkachuk. He was an actor, known for Heart of a Dog (1988), The Wizard of Oz (1974) and Andro i Sandro (1974). He was married to Mayya Gnezdovskaya. He died on January 10, 1994 in Moscow, Russia.
biography.name: Roman Tkachuk

biography.bio: Aleksandr Kuznetsov was born on May 21, 1935 in Moscow, RSFSR, USSR as Aleksandr Vsevolodovich Kuznetsov. He was an actor and director, known for Ballad of a Soldier (1959), U samogo Chyornogo morya (1975) and Chipollino (1972). He died on March 4, 2017 in Moscow, Russia.
biography.name: Aleksandr Kuznetsov

biography.bio: Georgiy Georgiu was born on August 26, 1915 in Smolensk, Russian Empire as Georgi Aleksandrovich Georgiu. He was an actor, known for Operation 'Y' & Other Shurik's Adventures (1965), Lechenie Vasiliya (1974) and Clear Skies (1961). He died on March 11, 1991 in Moscow, USSR.
biography.name: Georgiy Georgiu

biography.bio: Rudolf Rudin was born on December 22, 1928 as Rudolf Grigorevitch Rudin. He was an actor, known for Russkoe chudo (1994), Chipollino (1972) and Vashi paltsy pakhnut ladanom! (1993). He died on December 17, 2012.
biography.name: Rudolf Rudin

biography.placeOfBirth: Danilov, Yaroslavl Governorate, RSFSR [now Yaroslavl Oblast, Russia]
biography.bio: Aleksei Smirnov was born on February 26, 1920 in Danilov, Yaroslavl Governorate, RSFSR as Aleksei Makarovich Smirnov. He was an actor, known for Operation 'Y' & Other Shurik's Adventures (1965), Soyez les bienvenus (1964) and Baba Yaga (1973). He died on May 7, 1979 in Leningrad, Russian SFSR, USSR.
biography.name: Aleksei Smirnov

biography.bio: Natalya Krachkovskaya was born on November 24, 1938 in Moscow, USSR as Natalya Leonidovna Krachkovskaya. She was an actress, known for Ivan Vasilievich: Back to the Future (1973), Twelve Chairs (1971) and L'homme de boulevard des Capucines (1987). She was married to Vladimir Krachkovskiy. She died on March 3, 2016 in Moscow, Russia.
biography.name: Natalya Krachkovskaya
